The Mendel Langsam Family


Mendel Langsam (c.1815 - ?) had 2 known sons.

  • Ephraim (1835 - 1941) was married to Malka. They lived in Tereve/Lisko, Galicia & had 6 children. Ephraim lived to 106. He was killed by the Nazis. Here is a rough tree of the family.
    • Shaindel married Elya Mittman. They had 5 children.
      (Yitzchok) Irving living in Canarsie, Brooklyn, Alter, (Malka) Mollie Karp in Florida, Yankel (killed in a car accident), & Mendel (hit by a truck while on a bike)
    • Raizel married a Kessler. They had 3 children.
      Malka, Ben Zion, & Feivel
    • Chaim Shmuel was married and lived in Lviv, Ukraine. He and his family perished in the Holocaust.
      children
    • Tzvi Hersh was married and lived in Dinov, Galicia. He had many children. Two survived the war and came to the USA in '46 and went to Chicago.
      child, child, + others
    • Child died young.
    • Runya married her cousin, Dovid Langsam. They lived in Lisko and had many children.
      Chaya (who married her cousin Yakov Spinrad, father of Rabbi Boruch Spinrad) + others

  • Leibish (aka: Yehuda Aryeh Leib) (c.1850 - 1895) was married to Freida. They lived in Tereve/Lisko, Galicia & had 5 children.
    • Dovid (b. 1870), married his cousin, Runya Langsam. They lived in Lisko and had many children.
      Chaya (who married her cousin Yakov Spinrad, father of Rabbi Boruch Spinrad) + others
    • Elka (1877 - 1959) was married to Shmuel Spinrad and had six children. They came to the US in 1931. Their grandson, Rabbi Baruch Spinrad of Brooklyn, NY, supplied me with all this information.
      Yakov, Mendel, Mordechai, Chana, Shaya, & Rivka
    • Esther (1884 - 1978) was married to a Feldman. They came to the US in the 1920's.
      Leibish, Freida, Miriam, & Avrohm
    • Malya was married and lived in Radomsk. Her and her family perished in the Holocaust.
      children
    • Boruch drowned at age 19.


I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.

Moishe Miller
